data.title: Home
data.meta_description: At Capstone, it's not what you tell, but how you tell it. We engage readers by creating the right content for the right purpose for the right kid.
data.text:
Welcome to a New School Year!

Capstone hopes to help set you—and your students—up for success this school year. Check out our free activities for students, fun freebies for your library or classroom, curated booklists, and more. Get into the back-to-school frame of mind with Capstone!

Take a look at highlights from Capstone's Fall 2024 new titles! This season is all about book love, celebrating that special connection readers can have with the right book, starting with Author vs. Illustrator, a hilarious picture book about the not-so-simple process of creating a picture book, Overdue, a story about a forgotten library book told from his point of view, and The Pass, a tender story of sports, reading, and friendship, celebrating the empowerment and connection a good book can give. Also new this season is Tana Cooks, an early chapter book series about a Choctaw second-grader who loves to cook and bake with her family, and Cyber Sleuths, a middle grade mystery series created in collaboration with the International Society for Technology in Education (ISTE). Check out these books plus many more!

Looking for popular book characters that kids will love? From beloved characters like Katie Woo and Yasmin, to new characters sure to become reader’s next favorite, Capstone has an exciting lineup of book series for kids. Explore some of our most lovable characters and their stories.

Scary books are always in season and research shows reading age-appropriate scary stories with children is actually a good thing. Spooky stories excite and entice kids to read more. Reading scary stories can help kids confront their fears and learn important life lessons. Discover some of the best scary books for kids and some spooky activities to use in your classroom.
